definitions.definition: To determine the value of (a variable or expression).
To relate a statement (called a predicate ) to a given set using a quantifier —either for all (denoted ∀ ) or there exists (denoted ∃ ).
examples: The statement ( ∀ x ∈ R ) 2 x = x + x {\displaystyle (\forall x\in \mathbb {R} )\,2x=x+x} quantifies over the real numbers.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To assign a quantity to.
secondary_definitions: To determine the value of (a variable or expression).
( logic ) To relate a statement (called a predicate ) to a given set using a quantifier —either for all (denoted ∀ ) or there exists (denoted ∃ ).
